page.title: 05Biggin C of E School.
page.content: The{original school}was built of limestone in{1849.}A wooden partition divides this building into two classrooms. Attached to this building is a house in which previous headmasters used to live. In{1958}a{second block was built comprising one classroom and a kitchen,so all the school meals are cooked on the premises. Two years ago the school was {threatened with closure,}but the {villagers fought and won the case}so the school remains open. This term there are{34 pupils,}a headmistress and one teacher. There is a lot of grassland around the school and we have a large playing field for{football}etc. and a yard for {skittle ball.
